attributes.action: submit a law before Parliament to criminalise the offering of any form of inducements to Members of Parliament by the Prime Minister, Party Whips, Government Ministers or their agents in order to seek support in any vote put by the Speaker of the House.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: On 13th June 2008, the Speaker said that all votes in the House were to made by Members in accordance with their conscience (for exact words see Hansard). Yet it is common knowledge that "horse trading" does take place by all parties in the form of promises of appointments to Committees, future honours and monetary inducements from taxes to constituency or regional districts. This is another unacceptable form of Parliamentary depravity and must be rooted out. It is a betrayal of the Electorate.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
